description: Overwhelmed by community unrest and the growing trade in forged records, Daria Tomenko debates with colleagues about the future of Stenograd. She discovers the hidden 'Halden_Final' deletion protocol, a last-resort option to erase all BCI and Council data.

After reflecting on the risks of future misuse and the impossibility of restoring trust, Daria chooses to trigger the 'Halden_Final' protocol. She quietly authorizes the irreversible wipe, setting automated processes in motion across the city's network.

City residents wake to find the BCI system and all official records—housing, jobs, histories—gone. With the system's grip broken, confusion sweeps Stenograd as people seek new ways to verify identity and share their pasts.
Amid widespread uncertainty, black market gatherings emerge in parks and old public spaces. Citizens trade physical objects, heirlooms, and shared testimony to reconstruct their lives and histories.

Trust-based neighborhood councils form to resolve disputes using living witnesses instead of digital records. As the old Council loses all authority, Stenograd begins reshaping itself through personal connections and collective memory.
